org.gicentre.geomap
Interface Feature

All Known Implementing Classes:
Line, Point, Polygon
public interface Feature

Identifies the behaviour of all features.

Version:
1.2, 29th October, 2013.
Author:
Iain Dillingham and Jo Wood, giCentre, City University London.

Method Summary
 boolean contains(float x, float y)
          Should tests whether the given point is contained within the feature.

          Should draw the feature in the parent sketch.

          Should report the number of vertices that make up the feature definition.

          Should report the type of feature.

Method Detail

getType

FeatureType getType()
Should report the type of feature.

Returns:
Type of feature

draw

void draw(Geographic transformer)
Should draw the feature in the parent sketch.

Parameters:
transformer - Class that will transform between geographic and screen coordinates.

getNumVertices

int getNumVertices()
Should report the number of vertices that make up the feature definition.

Returns:
number of vertices that make up the feature.

contains

boolean contains(float x,
                 float y)
Should tests whether the given point is contained within the feature. The definition of 'contains' will depend on what type of feature is being tested. Coordinates should be in the same geographic units as the feature.

Parameters:
x - x coordinate in geographic coordinates.
y - y coordinate in geographic coordinates.
Returns:
True if the given point is contained within the feature, false if not.

setRenderer

void setRenderer(Drawable renderer)
Should set the renderer to be used for drawing this feature. This need only be set if some non-default rendering is required (such as the sketchy rendering produced by the Handy library).

Parameters:
renderer - New renderer to use or null if default rendering is to be used.
